Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Non smoker
Minimal alcohol consumption
Regular exercise

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP
Suboptimal vitamin D level
Above optimal fasting insulin level Slightly increased waist circumference

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

Comment Value: Nil

Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Dad has a stent, grandfather had a stroke, age over 45y, waist circumference over 80cm

Comment Value: None

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Slight microcytic hypochromic red cell picture - history of thalassaemia trait
hsCRP of 3.9
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Slight microcytic hypochromic red cell picture - history of thalassaemia trait
hsCRP of 3.9

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Slight microcytic hypochromic red cell picture - history of thalassaemia trait
hsCRP of 3.9
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Dad has a stent, grandfather had a stroke, age over 45y, waist circumference over 80cm

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation

Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: 0

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote

Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote

Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit & improve your present & future self.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.

Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote

Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Non smoker
Minimal alcohol consumption
Regular exercise
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
