Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP
Suboptimal vitamin D level
Above optimal fasting insulin level Slightly increased waist circumference
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.

Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: Slightly increased waist circumference
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: Slightly increased waist circumference
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Nil

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation

Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP
Suboptimal vitamin D level
Above optimal fasting insulin level Slightly increased waist circumference

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: None

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Raised hsCRP: suggests increased levels of inflammation in the body which puts you at higher risk for heart disease. You did have covid a few months ago which may have contributed. Things to consider to lower inflammation include a healthy mediterranean style diet, exercise, stress reduction, omega 3's and curcumin.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Dad has a stent, grandfather had a stroke, age over 45y, waist circumference over 80cm
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.

Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.

------------------------------
Employee: Shirmila Kuvarjee
Report Date: 2020-11-10
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a Radiologist for a mammogram. Consider seeing a gynae for an ultrasound. Recently went through menopause but you are relatively asymptomatic.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
Comment Key: WomensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Above optimal fasting insulin level: your level is within the normal range and does not suggest insulin resistance but an optimal level is around 5. Continue exercising and watch the sugar and refined carbohydrates in your diet.
Comment Key: WomensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: Suboptimal vitamin D level: your level has improved since last year. Continue to supplement with vitamin D and recheck in 4 to 6 months aiming for a level between 50 to 80 ng/ml.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Continue Pap smear & mammogram screening as recommended.
Overview Notes: We use body mass index (BMI) and waist to height ratio (WHtR) to assess the distribution of excess body fat. People who carry more weight around their mid section, known as 'apple-shape', are at higher risk for heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer. Your BMI is normal but your waist circumference is slightly high at 85cm. Try to reduce it to 80 cm or below.
